infobvc package

Submodules

infobvc.core module

infobvc.core.correlation_matrix(tickers: list = ['*'], min_date: str = '2022-01-01', max_date: str = '2023-07-15', agg_period: str = 'd', as_plot: bool = False)[source]

Correlation matrix of close prices for stocks, period and aggregation period selected.

Parameters:

  • tickers (list) – List containing the tickers. Default value is [‘*’] which means all available tickers.

  • min_date (str) – Minimum date. It must have %Y-%m-%d format.

  • max_date (str) – Maximum date. It must have %Y-%m-%d format.

  • agg_period (str) – Aggregation period. The only valid values are d (day), m (month), q (quarter) and y (year).

Returns:

  • df (pandas.DataFrame)

  • or

  • plot (seaborn.axisgrid.FacetGrid)

infobvc.core.get_fundamentals(tickers: list = ['*'], ratios: bool = False)[source]

Get fundamental data for tickers selected.

Parameters:

  • ticker (list) – List containing the tickers. Default value is [‘*’] which means all available tickers.

  • ratios (bool) – If True then fundamental ratios (P/E, P/B and Yield) are also returned. If False then fundamental ratios are not returned.

Return type:

df = pandas.DataFrame

infobvc.core.get_quotes(tickers: list = ['*'], min_date: str = '2022-01-01', max_date: str = '2023-07-15', agg_period: str = 'd')[source]

Get data of prices, quantities and volumes for stocks, period and aggregation period selected.

Parameters:

  • tickers (list) – List containing the tickers. Default value is [‘*’] which means all available tickers.

  • min_date (str) – Minimum date. It must have %Y-%m-%d format.

  • max_date (str) – Maximum date. It must have %Y-%m-%d format.

  • agg_period (str) – Aggregation period. The only valid values are d (day), m (month), q (quarter) and y (year).

Returns:

df

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

infobvc.core.get_technicals(tickers: list = ['*'])[source]

Get technical indicators (SMAs, EMAs, RSI) data for tickers selected.

Parameters:

tickers (list) – List containing the tickers. Default value is [‘*’] which means all available tickers.

Return type:

df = pandas.DataFrame

infobvc.core.plot_comparative_prices(tickers: list = ['*'], min_date: str = '2022-01-01', max_date: str = '2023-07-15', agg_period: str = 'd')[source]

Comparative plot of prices for stocks, period and aggregation period selected. Initial value is equivalent to 1 for every stock.

Parameters:

  • tickers (list) – List containing the tickers. Default value is [‘*’] which means all available tickers.

  • min_date (str) – Minimum date. It must have %Y-%m-%d format.

  • max_date (str) – Maximum date. It must have %Y-%m-%d format.

  • agg_period (str) – Aggregation period. The only valid values are d (day), m (month), q (quarter) and y (year).

Returns:

plot

Return type:

seaborn.axisgrid.FacetGrid

infobvc.core.plot_prices(tickers: list = ['*'], min_date: str = '2022-01-01', max_date: str = '2023-07-15', agg_period: str = 'd')[source]

Plot data of prices for stocks, period and aggregation period selected.

Parameters:

  • tickers (list) – List containing the tickers. Default value is [‘*’] which means all available tickers.

  • min_date (str) – Minimum date. It must have %Y-%m-%d format.

  • max_date (str) – Maximum date. It must have %Y-%m-%d format.

  • agg_period (str) – Aggregation period. The only valid values are d (day), m (month), q (quarter) and y (year).

Returns:

plot

Return type:

seaborn.axisgrid.FacetGrid
